history.content: It is read regardless of your situation and (from what I've heard) can only help and not hurt your application, so you should definitely fill it out!

Sorry for asking this question so late, I realize the major application form is due tonight! I'm currently filling it out in order to declare L&S CS as my second major and because I'm going to be a senior now, the old requirements still apply to me. Having picked up CS so late, I still have one last class to take to finish the 7 prereqs, but I would like to declare early just so that I will actually be able to get into the classes I need next semester and hopefully graduate on time. With my grades in the 5 classes I have so far (still waiting for the grade from the 6th this summer), I should be able to make the 3.0 cutoff alright, but probably won't make the 3.4 required for early declaration.

I've heard conflicting things about when the statement of purpose is actually taken into consideration so I was just hoping for some clarification on that. Should I fill it out and explain my circumstances about needing to declare early, or will it not be read on the account that I still have another chance to apply?

Thanks in advance for any advice!
history.subject: Statement of Purpose for Early Declaration
